Lamentations-1-1: Jerusalem Cries Over Her Destruction 1 Jerusalem once was a city full of people, 1 Jerusalem once was a city full of people,     but now the city is so empty. but now the city is so empty. She[a] was one of the greatest cities in the world,     but now she is like a poor widow. but now she is like a poor widow. She was once a princess among cities,     but now she has been made a slave. but now she has been made a slave.
Lamentations-1-2: 2 She cries bitterly in the night.     Her tears are on her cheeks. Her tears are on her cheeks.     She has no one to comfort her. She has no one to comfort her. Many nations were friendly to her,     but not one of them comforts her now. but not one of them comforts her now. All her friends have turned their backs on her     and have become her enemies. and have become her enemies.
Lamentations-1-3: 3 Judah suffered very much,     and then she was taken into captivity. and then she was taken into captivity. She lives among other nations     but has found no rest. but has found no rest. The people who chased her caught her     where there was no way out.[b] where there was no way out.[b]
Lamentations-1-4: 4 The roads to Zion are very sad,     because no one comes to Zion for the festivals anymore. because no one comes to Zion for the festivals anymore. All of Zion’s gates have been destroyed;     all her priests groan in sorrow. all her priests groan in sorrow. Zion’s young women have been taken away,[c]     and all this made Zion sad. and all this made Zion sad.
Lamentations-1-5: 5 Jerusalem’s enemies have won.     Her enemies have been successful. Her enemies have been successful. This happened because the Lord punished her.     He punished Jerusalem for her many sins. He punished Jerusalem for her many sins. Her children have gone away.     Their enemies captured them and took them away. Their enemies captured them and took them away.
Lamentations-1-6: 6 The beauty of Daughter Zion[d] has gone away.     Her princes were like deer that cannot find a meadow to feed in. Her princes were like deer that cannot find a meadow to feed in.     They walk away without strength from those who chased them. They walk away without strength from those who chased them.
Lamentations-1-7: 7 Jerusalem thinks back. She remembers the time when she was hurt     and when she lost her home. and when she lost her home. She remembers all the nice things that she had in the past.     She remembers those nice things that she had in the old days. She remembers those nice things that she had in the old days. She remembers when her people were captured by the enemy.     She remembers when there was no one to help her. She remembers when there was no one to help her. When her enemies saw her, they laughed,     because she was destroyed. because she was destroyed.
Lamentations-1-8: 8 Jerusalem sinned very badly.     Because Jerusalem sinned, Because Jerusalem sinned,     she became a ruined city that people shake their heads about. she became a ruined city that people shake their heads about. In the past people respected her.     But now they hate her, But now they hate her,     because they abused her. because they abused her. Jerusalem groaned     and turned away. and turned away.
Lamentations-1-9: 9 Jerusalem’s skirts were dirty.     She gave no thought to what would become of her. She gave no thought to what would become of her. Her fall was amazing.     She had no one to comfort her. She had no one to comfort her. She says, “Lord, see how I am hurt!     See how my enemy thinks he is so great!” See how my enemy thinks he is so great!”
Lamentations-1-10: 10 The enemy stretched out his hand.     He took all her nice things. He took all her nice things. In fact, she saw the foreign nations go inside her Temple.     And you said those people could not join in our assembly! And you said those people could not join in our assembly!
Lamentations-1-11: 11 All the people of Jerusalem are groaning.     All of her people are looking for food. All of her people are looking for food.     They are giving away all their nice things for food to stay alive. They are giving away all their nice things for food to stay alive. Jerusalem says, “Look, Lord. Look at me!     See how people hate me. See how people hate me.
Lamentations-1-12: 12 All you who pass by on the road, you don’t seem to care.     But look at me and see. But look at me and see. Is there any pain like my pain?     Is there any pain like the pain that has come to me? Is there any pain like the pain that has come to me? Is there any pain like the pain that the Lord has punished me with?     He has punished me on the day of his great anger. He has punished me on the day of his great anger.
Lamentations-1-13: 13 The Lord sent fire from above     that went down into my bones. that went down into my bones. He stretched out a net for my feet.     He turned me all the way around. He turned me all the way around. He made me into a wasteland.     I am sick all day. I am sick all day.
Lamentations-1-14: 14 “My sins were tied up like a yoke.     My sins were tied up in the Lord’s hands. My sins were tied up in the Lord’s hands. His yoke is on my neck.     He has made me weak. He has made me weak. He has given me to those     who I cannot stand up against. who I cannot stand up against.
Lamentations-1-15: 15 “The Lord rejected all my powerful men     who were inside the city. who were inside the city. Then he brought a group of people against me.     He brought them to kill my young soldiers. He brought them to kill my young soldiers. The Lord has trampled his dearest city[e]     like grapes in a winepress. like grapes in a winepress.
Lamentations-1-16: 16 “I cry about all these things.     Tears are flowing down my cheeks. Tears are flowing down my cheeks. There is no one near to comfort me.     There is no one who can make me feel better. There is no one who can make me feel better. My children are like a wasteland,     because the enemy won.” because the enemy won.”
Lamentations-1-17: 17 Zion spread out her hands.     There was no one to comfort her. There was no one to comfort her. The Lord had given orders to Jacob’s enemies.     He ordered them to surround the city. He ordered them to surround the city. Jerusalem has become a dirty rag     that her enemies threw away. that her enemies threw away.
Lamentations-1-18: 18 Now Jerusalem says, “I refused to listen to the Lord,     so he is right for doing these things. so he is right for doing these things. So listen, all you people!     Look at my pain! Look at my pain! My young women and men     have gone into captivity. have gone into captivity.
Lamentations-1-19: 19 I called out to my lovers,     but they tricked me. but they tricked me. My priests and my elders     have died in the city. have died in the city. They were looking for food for themselves.     They wanted to keep themselves alive. They wanted to keep themselves alive.
Lamentations-1-20: 20 “Look at me, Lord. I am in distress!     I am upset, as if my heart turned upside down inside of me. I am upset, as if my heart turned upside down inside of me. I feel this way because     I have been so stubborn. I have been so stubborn. Out in the streets,     I lost my children to the swords. I lost my children to the swords. Inside, it is like death.
Lamentations-1-21: 21 “Listen to me, I am groaning.     I have no one to comfort me. I have no one to comfort me. All my enemies have heard of my trouble.     They are happy that you did this to me. They are happy that you did this to me. You said there would be a time of punishment.     You said you would punish my enemies. You said you would punish my enemies. Now do what you said.     Let my enemies be like I am now. Let my enemies be like I am now.
Lamentations-1-22: 22 “Look how evil my enemies are!     Then you can treat them the same way you treated me Then you can treat them the same way you treated me     because of all my sins. because of all my sins. Do this because I am groaning again and again.     Do this because my heart is sick.” Do this because my heart is sick.”
Lamentations-2-1: The Lord Destroyed Jerusalem 2 Look how the Lord has covered daughter Zion[a] 2 Look how the Lord has covered daughter Zion[a]     with the cloud of his anger. with the cloud of his anger. He has thrown her, the glory of Israel,     from the sky to the ground. from the sky to the ground. In his anger he showed no care even for the Temple     where he rests his feet.[b] where he rests his feet.[b]
Lamentations-2-2: 2 The Lord destroyed the houses of Jacob.     He destroyed them without mercy. He destroyed them without mercy. In his anger he destroyed the fortresses of Daughter Judah.     He threw the kingdom of Judah and its rulers to the ground. He threw the kingdom of Judah and its rulers to the ground.     He ruined the kingdom of Judah. He ruined the kingdom of Judah.
Lamentations-2-3: 3 He was angry, and he destroyed     all the strength of Israel. all the strength of Israel. He took away his right hand from Israel.     He did this when the enemy came. He did this when the enemy came. He burned like a flaming fire in Jacob.     He was like a fire that burns all around. He was like a fire that burns all around.
Lamentations-2-4: 4 He bent his bow like an enemy.     He held his sword in his right hand. He held his sword in his right hand. He killed all the good-looking men of Judah.     He killed them as if they were the enemy. He killed them as if they were the enemy. He poured out his anger     like a fire on the tents of Zion. like a fire on the tents of Zion.
Lamentations-2-5: 5 The Lord has become like an enemy.     He has swallowed up Israel. He has swallowed up Israel. He has swallowed up all her palaces     and all her fortresses. and all her fortresses. He has made much sadness and crying     for the dead in Daughter Judah. for the dead in Daughter Judah.
Lamentations-2-6: 6 He pulled up his own tent[c]     as if it were a garden. as if it were a garden. He has ruined the place where the people     came together to worship him. came together to worship him. The Lord has made people forget     the special assemblies and special days of rest[d] in Zion. the special assemblies and special days of rest[d] in Zion. He rejected the king and the priests.     He was angry and rejected them. He was angry and rejected them.
Lamentations-2-7: 7 He rejected his altar,     and he left his holy place of worship. and he left his holy place of worship. He let the enemy pull down the walls     of the palaces of Jerusalem. of the palaces of Jerusalem. The enemy shouted with joy in the Lord’s Temple.     They made noise as though it were a festival. They made noise as though it were a festival.
Lamentations-2-8: 8 The Lord planned to destroy     the wall of Daughter Zion. the wall of Daughter Zion. He marked the wall with a measuring line.     He didn’t stop himself from destroying it. He didn’t stop himself from destroying it. He made all the walls cry out in sadness.     Together they wasted away. Together they wasted away.
Lamentations-2-9: 9 Jerusalem’s gates have sunk into the ground.     The bars on her gates are completely destroyed. The bars on her gates are completely destroyed. Her king and princes have been taken to other nations.     The teaching of the law has stopped. The teaching of the law has stopped. And her prophets no longer receive     visions from the Lord. visions from the Lord.
Lamentations-2-10: 10 The elders of Zion sit on the ground.     They sit on the ground and are quiet. They sit on the ground and are quiet. They pour dust on their heads.     They put on sackcloth. They put on sackcloth. The young women of Jerusalem     bow their heads to the ground in sorrow. bow their heads to the ground in sorrow.
Lamentations-2-11: 11 My eyes are worn out with tears,     and my insides are upset. and my insides are upset. My heart feels like it has been poured on the ground;     I feel this way because of the destruction of my people. I feel this way because of the destruction of my people. Children and babies are fainting     in the public squares of the city. in the public squares of the city.
Lamentations-2-12: 12 They ask their mothers,     “Where is the bread and wine?” “Where is the bread and wine?”     as they pour out their life in their mother’s laps. as they pour out their life in their mother’s laps.
Lamentations-2-13: 13 My dear Jerusalem, what can I say about you?     What can I compare you to? What can I compare you to? What can I say you are like?     How can I comfort you, city of Zion? How can I comfort you, city of Zion? You have been hurt much too badly     for anyone to heal. for anyone to heal.
Lamentations-2-14: 14 Your prophets saw visions for you,     but their visions were only worthless lies. but their visions were only worthless lies. They didn’t speak against your sins.     They didn’t try to make things better. They didn’t try to make things better. They spoke messages for you,     but they were false messages that fooled you. but they were false messages that fooled you.
Lamentations-2-15: 15 Those who pass by on the road     clap their hands and laugh at you. clap their hands and laugh at you. They make fun of Jerusalem,     shaking their heads at the sight of her. shaking their heads at the sight of her. They ask, “Is this the city that people called     ‘The Most Beautiful City’ ‘The Most Beautiful City’     and ‘The Joy of all the Earth’?” and ‘The Joy of all the Earth’?”
Lamentations-2-16: 16 All your enemies laugh at you.     They whistle and grind their teeth at you. They whistle and grind their teeth at you. They say, “We have swallowed them up!     This is the day we were hoping for. This is the day we were hoping for.     We have finally seen this happen!” We have finally seen this happen!”
Lamentations-2-17: 17 The Lord did what he planned to do.     He did what he said he would do. He did what he said he would do.     He did what he commanded a long time ago. He did what he commanded a long time ago. He destroyed, and he had no pity.     He made your enemies happy because of what happened to you. He made your enemies happy because of what happened to you.     He made your enemies strong. He made your enemies strong.
Lamentations-2-18: 18 Cry out with all your heart[e] to the Lord!     Jerusalem, let tears roll down your walls. Jerusalem, let tears roll down your walls.     Let your tears flow like a stream day and night. Let your tears flow like a stream day and night. Don’t stop crying     or let your eyes dry. or let your eyes dry.
Lamentations-2-19: 19 Get up throughout the night and cry for help.     Let your sorrow pour out before the Lord like water. Let your sorrow pour out before the Lord like water. Lift up your hands in prayer to him.     Ask him to let your children live. Ask him to let your children live.     They are starving to death on every street corner. They are starving to death on every street corner.
Lamentations-2-20: 20 Look at us, Lord!     Have you ever treated anyone else so badly? Have you ever treated anyone else so badly? Is it right for women to eat their own babies,     the children they have cared for? the children they have cared for? Should priests and prophets be killed     in the Temple of the Lord? in the Temple of the Lord?
Lamentations-2-21: 21 Young men and old men     lie on the ground in the streets of the city. lie on the ground in the streets of the city. My young women and young men     have been killed by the sword. have been killed by the sword. You killed them on the day of your anger.     You killed them without mercy! You killed them without mercy!
Lamentations-2-22: 22 You invited terror to come to me from all around.     You invited terror as though you were inviting it to a festival. You invited terror as though you were inviting it to a festival. No one escaped on the day of the Lord’s anger.     My enemy killed the people who I raised and brought up. My enemy killed the people who I raised and brought up.
Lamentations-3-1: The Meaning of Suffering 3 I am a man who has seen much trouble. 3 I am a man who has seen much trouble.     God beat us with a stick, and I saw it happen. God beat us with a stick, and I saw it happen.
Lamentations-3-2: 2 He led and brought me     into darkness, not light. into darkness, not light.
Lamentations-3-3: 3 He turned his hand against me.     He did this again and again, all day. He did this again and again, all day.
Lamentations-3-4: 4 He wore out my flesh and skin.     He broke my bones. He broke my bones.
Lamentations-3-5: 5 He built up bitterness and trouble against me.     He surrounded me with bitterness and trouble. He surrounded me with bitterness and trouble.
Lamentations-3-6: 6 He put me in the dark,     like someone who died long ago. like someone who died long ago.
Lamentations-3-7: 7 He shut me in, so I could not get out.     He put heavy chains on me. He put heavy chains on me.
Lamentations-3-8: 8 Even when I cry out and ask for help,     he does not listen to my prayer. he does not listen to my prayer.
Lamentations-3-9: 9 He has blocked up my path with stones.     He has made my path crooked. He has made my path crooked.
Lamentations-3-10: 10 He is like a bear about to attack me,     like a lion that is in a hiding place. like a lion that is in a hiding place.
Lamentations-3-11: 11 He led me off my path.     He tore me to pieces and ruined me. He tore me to pieces and ruined me.
Lamentations-3-12: 12 He made his bow ready.     He made me the target for his arrows. He made me the target for his arrows.
Lamentations-3-13: 13 He shot me in the stomach     with his arrows. with his arrows.
Lamentations-3-14: 14 I have become a joke to all my people.     All day long they sing songs about me and make fun of me. All day long they sing songs about me and make fun of me.
Lamentations-3-15: 15 He gave me this poison to drink.     He filled me with this bitter drink. He filled me with this bitter drink.
Lamentations-3-16: 16 He pushed my teeth into rocky ground.     He pushed me into the dirt. He pushed me into the dirt.
Lamentations-3-17: 17 I thought I would never have peace again.     I forgot about good things. I forgot about good things.
Lamentations-3-18: 18 I said to myself, “I no longer have any hope     that the Lord will help me.” that the Lord will help me.”
Lamentations-3-19: 19 Remember, I am very sad,     and I have no home. and I have no home.     Remember the bitter poison that you gave me. Remember the bitter poison that you gave me.
Lamentations-3-20: 20 I remember well all my troubles,     and I am very sad. and I am very sad.
Lamentations-3-21: 21 But then I think about this,     and I have hope: and I have hope:
Lamentations-3-22: 22 We are still alive because     the Lord’s faithful love never ends. the Lord’s faithful love never ends.
Lamentations-3-23: 23 Every morning he shows it in new ways!     You are so very true and loyal! You are so very true and loyal!
Lamentations-3-24: 24 I say to myself, “The Lord is my God,     and I trust him.”[a] and I trust him.”[a]
Lamentations-3-25: 25 The Lord is good to those who wait for him.     He is good to those who look for him. He is good to those who look for him.
Lamentations-3-26: 26 It is good to wait quietly     for the Lord to save them. for the Lord to save them.
Lamentations-3-27: 27 It is good for a man to wear his yoke     from the time he is young. from the time he is young.
Lamentations-3-28: 28 He should sit alone and be quiet     when the Lord puts his yoke on him. when the Lord puts his yoke on him.
Lamentations-3-29: 29 He should bow down to the Lord.     Maybe there is still hope. Maybe there is still hope.
Lamentations-3-30: 30 He should turn his cheek to the one who hits him     and let people insult him. and let people insult him.
Lamentations-3-31: 31 He should remember that     the Lord does not reject people forever. the Lord does not reject people forever.
Lamentations-3-32: 32 When he punishes, he also has mercy.     He has mercy because of his great love and kindness. He has mercy because of his great love and kindness.
Lamentations-3-33: 33 He does not enjoy causing people pain.     He does not like to make anyone unhappy. He does not like to make anyone unhappy.
Lamentations-3-34: 34 He does not like any prisoner on earth     to be trampled down. to be trampled down.
Lamentations-3-35: 35 He does not like anyone to be unfair to another person.     Some people will do such things right in front of God Most High. Some people will do such things right in front of God Most High.
Lamentations-3-36: 36 The Lord does not like anyone to cheat another person.     He does not like any of these things. He does not like any of these things.
Lamentations-3-37: 37 No one can say something and make it happen,     unless the Lord orders it. unless the Lord orders it.
Lamentations-3-38: 38 God Most High commands     both good and bad things to happen. both good and bad things to happen.
Lamentations-3-39: 39 No one alive can complain     when he punishes them for their sins. when he punishes them for their sins.
Lamentations-3-40: 40 Let us check and see what we have done.     Then let us turn back to the Lord. Then let us turn back to the Lord.
Lamentations-3-41: 41 Let us lift up our hearts and our hands     to the God of heaven. to the God of heaven.
Lamentations-3-42: 42 Let us say to him, “We have sinned and have been stubborn.     Because of this, you have not forgiven us. Because of this, you have not forgiven us.
Lamentations-3-43: 43 You wrapped yourself with anger.     You chased us. You chased us.     You killed us without mercy! You killed us without mercy!
Lamentations-3-44: 44 You wrapped yourself in a cloud     so that no prayer could get through. so that no prayer could get through.
Lamentations-3-45: 45 You made us like garbage and dirt     to the other nations. to the other nations.
Lamentations-3-46: 46 All of our enemies     speak angrily against us. speak angrily against us.
Lamentations-3-47: 47 We have been frightened.     We have fallen into a pit. We have fallen into a pit. We have been badly hurt.     We have been broken.” We have been broken.”
Lamentations-3-48: 48 My eyes flow with streams of tears.     I cry because of the destruction of my people. I cry because of the destruction of my people.
Lamentations-3-49: 49 My eyes will flow without stopping.     I will keep on crying. I will keep on crying.
Lamentations-3-50: 50 I will continue to cry     until you look down and see us, Lord! until you look down and see us, Lord! I will continue to cry     until you see us from heaven. until you see us from heaven.
Lamentations-3-51: 51 My eyes make me sad, when I see     what happened to the young women in my city. what happened to the young women in my city.
Lamentations-3-52: 52 For no reason,     my enemies hunted me like a bird. my enemies hunted me like a bird.
Lamentations-3-53: 53 They threw me alive into a pit     and then threw stones at me. and then threw stones at me.
Lamentations-3-54: 54 Water came up over my head.     I said to myself, “I am finished.” I said to myself, “I am finished.”
Lamentations-3-55: 55 Lord, I called your name     from the bottom of the pit. from the bottom of the pit.
Lamentations-3-56: 56 You heard my voice.     You didn’t close your ears. You didn’t close your ears.     You didn’t refuse to rescue me. You didn’t refuse to rescue me.
Lamentations-3-57: 57 You came to me on the day that I called out to you.     You said to me, “Don’t be afraid.” You said to me, “Don’t be afraid.”
Lamentations-3-58: 58 You defended me     and brought me back to life. and brought me back to life.
Lamentations-3-59: 59 Lord, you have seen my trouble.     Now judge my case for me. Now judge my case for me.
Lamentations-3-60: 60 You have seen how my enemies have hurt me.     You have seen all the evil plans that they made against me. You have seen all the evil plans that they made against me.
Lamentations-3-61: 61 You heard them insult me, Lord.     You have heard all the evil plans that they made against me. You have heard all the evil plans that they made against me.
Lamentations-3-62: 62 The words and the thoughts of my enemies     are against me all the time— are against me all the time—
Lamentations-3-63: 63     when they sit down and when they stand up. 63     when they sit down and when they stand up.     Look how they make fun of me! Look how they make fun of me!
Lamentations-3-64: 64 Give them back what they deserve, Lord.     Pay them back for what they have done. Pay them back for what they have done.
Lamentations-3-65: 65 Make them stubborn     and then curse them. and then curse them.
Lamentations-3-66: 66 Chase them in anger and destroy them.     Wipe them off the face of the earth, Lord! Wipe them off the face of the earth, Lord!
Lamentations-4-1: The Horrors of the Attack on Jerusalem 4 See how the gold has grown dark, 4 See how the gold has grown dark,     how the pure gold has changed. how the pure gold has changed. There are jewels[a] scattered all around     at every street corner. at every street corner.
Lamentations-4-2: 2 The precious people of Zion     were once worth more than gold. were once worth more than gold. But now they are treated like something worthless,     like the cheap clay jars a potter makes. like the cheap clay jars a potter makes.
Lamentations-4-3: 3 Even a wild dog feeds her babies.     Even the jackal lets her pups suck at her breast. Even the jackal lets her pups suck at her breast. But the daughter of my people[b] is cruel.     She is like the ostrich in the desert that forgets its eggs in the sand. She is like the ostrich in the desert that forgets its eggs in the sand.
Lamentations-4-4: 4 Babies are so thirsty     their tongues stick to the roof of their mouths. their tongues stick to the roof of their mouths. Young children ask for bread,     but no one gives them any. but no one gives them any.
Lamentations-4-5: 5 Those who ate rich food     are now dying in the streets. are now dying in the streets. Those who grew up wearing nice red clothes     now pick through garbage piles. now pick through garbage piles.
Lamentations-4-6: 6 The sin of the daughter of my people was very great.     Their sin was greater than the sins of Sodom and Gomorrah. Their sin was greater than the sins of Sodom and Gomorrah. Sodom and Gomorrah were destroyed suddenly.     No human hand caused their destruction.[c] No human hand caused their destruction.[c]
Lamentations-4-7: 7 Some of the men of Judah were dedicated to God in a special way.     They were very pure. They were very pure. They were whiter than snow,     and whiter than milk. and whiter than milk. Their bodies were red like coral     and their beards like sapphire stones. and their beards like sapphire stones.
Lamentations-4-8: 8 But now their faces are blacker than soot.     No one even recognizes them in the streets. No one even recognizes them in the streets. Their skin is wrinkled over their bones.     Their skin is like wood. Their skin is like wood.
Lamentations-4-9: 9 It was better for those who were killed by the sword     than for those who died of hunger. than for those who died of hunger. Those starving people were sad and hurt.     They died because they got no food from the field. They died because they got no food from the field.
Lamentations-4-10: 10 Then even nice women     cooked their own children. cooked their own children. The children were food for their mothers.     This happened when my people were destroyed. This happened when my people were destroyed.
Lamentations-4-11: 11 The Lord used all of his anger.     He poured out all his anger. He poured out all his anger. He made a fire in Zion     that burned it down to the foundations. that burned it down to the foundations.
Lamentations-4-12: 12 The kings of the earth could not believe what had happened.     The people of the world could not believe what had happened. The people of the world could not believe what had happened. They could not believe that enemies     would be able to come through the city gates of Jerusalem. would be able to come through the city gates of Jerusalem.
Lamentations-4-13: 13 This happened because the prophets     of Jerusalem sinned. of Jerusalem sinned. This happened because the priests     of Jerusalem did evil things. of Jerusalem did evil things. They were shedding the blood of good people     in the city of Jerusalem. in the city of Jerusalem.
Lamentations-4-14: 14 The prophets and priests walked around     like blind men in the streets. like blind men in the streets. They had become dirty with blood.     No one could even touch their clothes because they were dirty. No one could even touch their clothes because they were dirty.
Lamentations-4-15: 15 People shouted, “Go away!     Go away! Don’t touch us.” Go away! Don’t touch us.” They wandered around and had no home.     People in other nations said, People in other nations said,     “We don’t want them to live with us.” “We don’t want them to live with us.”
Lamentations-4-16: 16 The Lord himself destroyed them.     He didn’t look after them anymore. He didn’t look after them anymore. He didn’t respect the priests.     He was not friendly to the elders of Judah. He was not friendly to the elders of Judah.
Lamentations-4-17: 17 We have worn out our eyes looking for help,     but no help comes. but no help comes. We kept on looking for a nation to save us.     We kept watch from our watchtower, We kept watch from our watchtower,     but no nation came to us. but no nation came to us.
Lamentations-4-18: 18 Our enemies hunted us all the time.     We could not even go out into the streets. We could not even go out into the streets. Our end came near. Our time was up.     Our end came! Our end came!
Lamentations-4-19: 19 The men who chased us     were faster than eagles in the sky. were faster than eagles in the sky. They chased us into the mountains.     They hid in the desert to catch us. They hid in the desert to catch us.
Lamentations-4-20: 20 The king was very important to us. He was like the breath we breathe,     but he was trapped by them. but he was trapped by them. The Lord himself chose the king,     and we said this about the king, and we said this about the king, “We will live in his shadow.     He protects us from the nations.” He protects us from the nations.”
Lamentations-4-21: 21 Be happy, people of Edom.     Be happy, you who live in the land of Uz. Be happy, you who live in the land of Uz. But remember, the cup of the Lord’s anger will come around to you too.     When you drink from that cup, When you drink from that cup,     you will get drunk and strip off all your clothes. you will get drunk and strip off all your clothes.
Lamentations-4-22: 22 Your punishment is complete, Zion.     You will not go into captivity again. You will not go into captivity again. But the Lord will punish your sins, people of Edom.     He will uncover your sins. He will uncover your sins.
Lamentations-5-1: A Prayer to the Lord 5 Remember, Lord, what happened to us. 5 Remember, Lord, what happened to us.     Look and see our shame. Look and see our shame.
Lamentations-5-2: 2 Our land has been turned over to strangers.     Our houses have been given to foreigners. Our houses have been given to foreigners.
Lamentations-5-3: 3 We have become orphans.     We have no father. We have no father.     Our mothers have become like widows. Our mothers have become like widows.
Lamentations-5-4: 4 We have to buy the water that we drink.     We have to pay for the wood that we use. We have to pay for the wood that we use.
Lamentations-5-5: 5 We are forced to wear a yoke on our necks.     We get tired, and we have no rest. We get tired, and we have no rest.
Lamentations-5-6: 6 We made an agreement with Egypt.     We also made an agreement with Assyria to get enough bread. We also made an agreement with Assyria to get enough bread.
Lamentations-5-7: 7 Our ancestors sinned against you, and now they are dead.     And we are suffering because of their sins. And we are suffering because of their sins.
Lamentations-5-8: 8 Slaves have become our rulers.     No one can save us from them. No one can save us from them.
Lamentations-5-9: 9 We risk our lives to get food.     There are men in the desert with swords. There are men in the desert with swords.
Lamentations-5-10: 10 Our skin is hot like an oven.     We have a high fever because of our hunger. We have a high fever because of our hunger.
Lamentations-5-11: 11 The enemy raped the women of Zion.     They raped the women in the cities of Judah. They raped the women in the cities of Judah.
Lamentations-5-12: 12 The enemy hanged our princes.     They didn’t honor our elders. They didn’t honor our elders.
Lamentations-5-13: 13 The enemy made our young men grind grain at the mill.     Our young men stumbled under loads of wood. Our young men stumbled under loads of wood.
Lamentations-5-14: 14 The elders no longer sit at the gates of the city.     The young men no longer make music. The young men no longer make music.
Lamentations-5-15: 15 We have no more joy in our hearts.     Our dancing has changed to crying for the dead. Our dancing has changed to crying for the dead.
Lamentations-5-16: 16 The crown has fallen from our head.     Things have gone bad for us because we sinned. Things have gone bad for us because we sinned.
Lamentations-5-17: 17 For this reason, our hearts have become sick,     and our eyes cannot see clearly. and our eyes cannot see clearly.
Lamentations-5-18: 18 Mount Zion is a wasteland.     Foxes run around on Mount Zion. Foxes run around on Mount Zion.
Lamentations-5-19: 19 But you rule forever, Lord.     Your kingly chair lasts forever and ever. Your kingly chair lasts forever and ever.
Lamentations-5-20: 20 You seem to have forgotten us forever.     You seem to have left us alone for such a long time. You seem to have left us alone for such a long time.
Lamentations-5-21: 21 Bring us back to you, Lord.     We will gladly come back to you. We will gladly come back to you.     Make our lives as they were before. Make our lives as they were before.
Lamentations-5-22: 22 You were very angry with us.     Have you completely rejected us? Have you completely rejected us?
